Title: Connectional networks within the orbital and medial prefrontal cortex of Macaque monkeys
Abstract: The intrinsic cortico-cortical connections within the orbital and medial prefrontal cortex (OMPFC) were demonstrated with retrograde and anterograde tracers injected into each of the architectonic areas that constitute this region. Although many of the connections linked neighboring areas, others selectively connected relatively distant areas. Most, but not all, of the connections were reciprocal. Altogether, the connections formed at least two distinct networks within the OMPFC. The "orbital" prefrontal network linked most of the areas within the orbital cortex, with very few connections to medial prefrontal areas. Areas Iam, Iapm, Ial, 12l, 12m, and 12r in the caudal and lateral parts of the orbital cortex (which received inputs from several sensory modalities) had convergent connections with areas 13l, 13m, and 13b in the central orbital cortex, with further connections to the rostral orbital area 11l. For the connections between areas Iapm, Iam, Ial, 13m, 13l, and 11l, rostrally directed fibers arose mainly in layer V, whereas caudally directed fibers originated mainly in layer III. The "medial" prefrontal network selectively involved medial areas 14r, 14c, 24, 25, 32, and 10m, rostral orbital areas 10o and 11m, and agranular insular area Iai in the posterior orbital cortex. Two orbital areas, 13a and 12o, had substantial connections to both networks and may serve as points of interaction between them; otherwise there were relatively few interconnections. The two networks also had distinct connections with other cortical regions, with limbic structures, and with the mediodorsal thalamic nucleus. Their role in guidance of affective behaviour is discussed.

@Injections.Citation: "A small retrograde tracer injection placed in the middle of area 32 produced a dense concentration of labeled cells in most parts of areas 32 and 24b"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Case OM7 is representative of this pattern. A small retrograde tracer injection placed in the middle of area 32 produced a dense concentration of labeled cells in most parts of areas 32 and 24b (Figs. 2, 3). The labeled cells extended ventral to the genu of the corpus callosum and into the rostral part of area 24a dorsal to the genu. A dense patch of labeled cells also occupied the mid portion of area 24b and extended rostrally along the border with area 9 as far as area 10m. There was relatively little label in the orbital cortex, but there was a notable, dense patch of labeled cells in area 10o at the frontal pole and in areas 12o, Iai, and 13a caudally. More scattered cells were found at the edges of areas 13l,14c, and 11m adjacent to the zones of heavy label."

@Injections.Citation: "The more dorsal injection in dorsal area 32 and area 24b (case OM3)..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The more dorsal injection in dorsal area 32 and area 24b (case OM3) labeled a substantial patch at the frontal pole, but fewer cells elsewhere."

@Injections.Citation: "One retrograde tracer injection was confined to area 11l (case OM21, Fig. 14)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "With a small retrograde tracer injection in area 11l in case OM21, densely packed labeled cells were found in the lateral and central orbital cortex, in areas 12r, 12m, 12l, 13m, and 13l (Fig. 14). Observations from retrograde tracer injections into these five areas (described above, Figs. 10, 11) indicate that these projections are reciprocal. In the posterior orbital cortex labeled cells were also found in area Ial and the rostral part of area Iam, but very few cells were labeled in areas Iai or 12o. In addition, there were many labeled cells present in OM21 in areas 45 and 46 in the ventral bank of the principal sulcus, and a moderate number of cells were labeled in area 10o at the frontal pole. As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), labeled cells were also found in areas 6va and 6vb."

@Injections.Citation: "In OM13 two injections of retrograde tracers (fast blue and diamidino yellow) were placed into non-overlapping parts of area 11m."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Dense concentrations of retrogradely labeled cells filled area 11m and continued caudally in a strip through areas 13b and 13a. A dense collection of labeled cells was also found in area Iai, and scattered cells were present in 12o. In the medial wall, patches of labeled cells were present in area 32, and in the rostral part of area 24a near the genu of the corpus callosum (see also Carmichael and Price, 1995a). Patches of labeled cells were also present in dorsolateral prefrontal areas 9 and 46. Thus, unlike area 11l, area 11m receives input primarily from the medial orbital cortex, the medial wall, and the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, and from orbital areas that connect with the medial wall, especially area Iai. Areas 11m and 11l are only partially interconnected. The injections into area 11m label many cells only in the rostral and medial part of area 11l (Fig. 14). Similarly, the injection into the caudolateral part of area 11l in OM21 labeled only a few cells in 11m."

@Injections.Citation: "Although the retrograde tracer injection into area 100 (OM19; Fig. 15)..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Although the retrograde tracer injection into area 10o (OM19; Fig. 15) produced a pattern of label that was similar to that with injections into areas 14r and 14c, there were some differences. Most notably, there were more labeled cells in areas 46 and 9, and fewer in the more caudal areas of the gyrus rectus and medial wall. Within the orbital cortex, labeled cells were again present in areas 12o and Iai."

@Injections.Citation: "Both anterograde and retrograde tracer injections were placed into area 14r, in OM18 and OM19, respectively."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Following retrograde tracer injections into either areas 14c or 14r, dense concentrations of labeled cells and fibers fill both areas and extends into areas 10m, 10o, 11m, 13b, 25,32, and the rostral part of area 24b (Fig. 15). Label is also found in the rostral part of the dorsolateral areas 46 and 9. There is also substantial label in areas Iai and 12o, but very little label elsewhere in the orbital cortex (Fig. 15)"

@Injections.Citation: "The injection into area 24a labeled many cells in areas 32 and 24b, but not in area 10m (case OM11)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The injection into area 24a labeled many cells in areas 32 and 24b, but not in area 10m (case OM11). In all three cases substantial numbers of labeled cells were also found in area 9 in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex."

@Injections.Citation: "In this experiment, a retrograde tracer injection was placed into area Iam with slight involvement of the medial edge of area Iai."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A dense concentration of labeled cells was present in the neighboring areas Ial, Iapm, Iapl, and 13m. Although area Iai is laterally adjacent to area Iam and was slightly involved in the injection, it contained fewer labeled cells than the other agranular insula areas (Figs. 6, 7). In other areas of the orbital cortex, densely packed clusters of labeled cells were present in at least part of areas 12l, 12o, 11l, 13l, 13a, 13b, and 14c (Figs. 6, 7). Labeled cells also extended caudally from area 12l into area PrCO."

@Injections.Citation: "The central orbital areas 13m and 13l receive inputs primarily from posterior and lateral orbital areas. Retrograde tracer injections into these areas (OM5 and OM12, Fig. 10)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The central orbital areas 13m and 13l receive inputs primarily from posterior and lateral orbital areas. Retrograde tracer injections into these areas (OM5 and OM12, Fig. 10) labeled a substantial number of cells in all of the agranular insular areas except area Iai, which again stood out as a relatively unlabeled area. The injections into areas 13m and 13l also labeled a substantial number of cells in areas 12m, the ventral part of area 12l and PrCO. Both injections also labeled cells in the caudal part of area 11l (Fig. 10). Like area Iai, area 12o stood out as a relatively unlabeled area, with only scattered labeled cells, mostly near the other heavily labeled areas. In spite of their overall similarity, there are several important differences in the connections of areas 13l and 13m. Area 13l has more substantial connections with lateral orbital areas, whereas 13m is more closely connected with medial orbital areas. The retrograde tracer injection into area 13l labeled a dense population of cells that fill the entire extent of area 12m, whereas the injection in area 13m labeled only a small patch of columns in the middle of this area (Fig. 10). There are substantial projections to area 13l from the gustatory cortex and ventral area 6 (6va and 6vb) that were not found to area 13m (Fig. 10, see also Carmichael and Price, 1995b). In contrast, the injection in area 13m labeled a number of cells in medial orbital areas 13b, 13a, and 14c, which were not labeled from area 13l."

@Injections.Citation: "The central orbital areas 13m and 13l receive inputs primarily from posterior and lateral orbital areas. Retrograde tracer injections into these areas (OM5 and OM12, Fig. 10)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The central orbital areas 13m and 13l receive inputs primarily from posterior and lateral orbital areas. Retrograde tracer injections into these areas (OM5 and OM12, Fig. 10) labeled a substantial number of cells in all of the agranular insular areas except area Iai, which again stood out as a relatively unlabeled area. The injections into areas 13m and 13l also labeled a substantial number of cells in areas 12m, the ventral part of area 12l and PrCO. Both injections also labeled cells in the caudal part of area 11l (Fig. 10). Like area Iai, area 12o stood out as a relatively unlabeled area, with only scattered labeled cells, mostly near the other heavily labeled areas. In spite of their overall similarity, there are several important differences in the connections of areas 13l and 13m. Area 13l has more substantial connections with lateral orbital areas, whereas 13m is more closely connected with medial orbital areas. The retrograde tracer injection into area 13l labeled a dense population of cells that fill the entire extent of area 12m, whereas the injection in area 13m labeled only a small patch of columns in the middle of this area (Fig. 10). There are substantial projections to area 13l from the gustatory cortex and ventral area 6 (6va and 6vb) that were not found to area 13m (Fig. 10, see also Carmichael and Price, 1995b). In contrast, the injection in area 13m labeled a number of cells in medial orbital areas 13b, 13a, and 14c, which were not labeled from area 13l."

@Injections.Citation: "Three retrograde tracer injections were placed into areas 12r, 12l, and 12m (cases OM20, OM9 and OM14, respectively; Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In all three cases there were substantial numbers of retrogradely labeled cells present in areas 12r, 12m, and 12l themselves, and in area 11l. In contrast, most of area 12o contained fewer labeled cells. The injections into areas 12l and 12m also labeled apparently complementary strips or patches of cells in areas 13l and 13m. Areas 12r, 12m, and 12l also all receive input from the portion of area 46 on the ventral bank of the principal sulcus, although the injections in each area labeled a different group of cells in this region (Fig. 11). The injection in area 12m labeled cells in the cortex on the ventral lip of the principal sulcus, in a position that appears to correspond to area 46vr of Preuss and Goldman-Rakic (1989). There are also projections from area 45, especially to areas 12r and 12l. As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), both areas 12l and 12r receive a projection from the dorsal part of area 6, in an area that probably corresponds to the supplementary eye field (6d and SEF in Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: There is a damage in this area, so the extent of label is not specifically detectable
The mentioned part of area 6d probably corresponds to SEF

@Injections.Citation: "Three retrograde tracer injections were placed into areas 12r, 12l, and 12m (cases OM20, OM9 and OM14, respectively; Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In all three cases there were substantial numbers of retrogradely labeled cells present in areas 12r, 12m, and 12l themselves, and in area 11l. In contrast, most of area 12o contained fewer labeled cells. The injections into areas 12l and 12m also labeled apparently complementary strips or patches of cells in areas 13l and 13m. Areas 12r, 12m, and 12l also all receive input from the portion of area 46 on the ventral bank of the principal sulcus, although the injections in each area labeled a different group of cells in this region (Fig. 11). The injection in area 12m labeled cells in the cortex on the ventral lip of the principal sulcus, in a position that appears to correspond to area 46vr of Preuss and Goldman-Rakic (1989). There are also projections from area 45, especially to areas 12r and 12l. As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), both areas 12l and 12r receive a projection from the dorsal part of area 6, in an area that probably corresponds to the supplementary eye field (6d and SEF in Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: The labeled area probably corresponds to SEF

@Injections.Citation: "Three retrograde tracer injections were placed into areas 12r, 12l, and 12m (cases OM20, OM9 and OM14, respectively; Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In all three cases there were substantial numbers of retrogradely labeled cells present in areas 12r, 12m, and 12l themselves, and in area 11l. In contrast, most of area 12o contained fewer labeled cells. The injections into areas 12l and 12m also labeled apparently complementary strips or patches of cells in areas 13l and 13m. Areas 12r, 12m, and 12l also all receive input from the portion of area 46 on the ventral bank of the principal sulcus, although the injections in each area labeled a different group of cells in this region (Fig. 11). The injection in area 12m labeled cells in the cortex on the ventral lip of the principal sulcus, in a position that appears to correspond to area 46vr of Preuss and Goldman-Rakic (1989). There are also projections from area 45, especially to areas 12r and 12l. As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), both areas 12l and 12r receive a projection from the dorsal part of area 6, in an area that probably corresponds to the supplementary eye field (6d and SEF in Fig. 11)."

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: appears to correspond to area 46vr of Preuss and Goldman-Rakic (1989)

@Injections.Citation: "Both retrograde and anterograde tracer injections were placed into area 13a (cases OM15 and OM19, respectively; Fig. 13),..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The injections into area 13a produced many labeled cells and axons throughout most of area 13b.[...] Both areas 13a and 13b are also connected with areas in the central and lateral orbital cortex, including areas 11m, 13m, 12o, and to a lesser extent 13l (Fig. 13). In addition, the injections in area 13a labeled dense concentrations of cells or axons in agranular insular areas Iam, Iai, and Iapm, and in areas 14r and 14c."

@Injections.Citation: "Retrograde tracer injections into areas Iapm (case OM18, Fig. 8) and Ial (case OM22, Fig. 8) labeled a similar pattern of connections"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A dense population of labeled cells was present in areas Iam, Iapl, Ial, Iapm, and 13m, but there were few labeled cells in areas Iai, 12o, or 13l. In both cases, only the cortex at the edge of area Iai nearest the injection contained substantial numbers of labeled cells. Outside of the posterior orbital surface, there were labeled cells in the gustatory cortex in all of the experiments, although these were much more numerous following the injection into area Ial than in the other cases (Fig. 8). As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), Ial also receives a projection from area 24c in the face region of the rostral cingulate motor area, which is not directed to areas Iapm or Iam."

@Injections.Citation: "Retrograde tracer injections into areas Iapm (case OM18, Fig. 8) and Ial (case OM22, Fig. 8) labeled...."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A dense population of labeled cells was present in areas Iam, Iapl, Ial, Iapm, and 13m, but there were few labeled cells in areas Iai, 12o, or 13l. In both cases, only the cortex at the edge of area Iai nearest the injection contained substantial numbers of labeled cells. Outside of the posterior orbital surface, there were labeled cells in the gustatory cortex in all of the experiments, although these were much more numerous following the injection into area Ial than in the other cases (Fig. 8). As described previously (Carmichael and Price, 1995b), Ial also receives a projection from area 24c in the face region of the rostral cingulate motor area, which is not directed to areas Iapm or Iam."

@Injections.Citation: "When the injection involved the most ventral part of 32 and 10m (case OM4),..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "When the injection involved the most ventral part of 32 and 10m (case OM4), strips of labeled cells extended rostrally to the frontal pole, and from the caudal part of area 10m through area 25, primarily in layer V."

@Injections.Citation: "Two retrograde tracer injections were made into area Iai (OM15, Fig. 9 and MN12, not illustrated)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Each produced a similar pattern of cell labeling. Relatively few labeled cells were diffusely scattered in neighboring areas Iam, Ial, and Iapl. Area Iapm contained more cells, predominately in layer V (see below). More strikingly, area Iai receives a dense projection from prefrontal areas that do not project substantially to the other agranular insular areas. A patch of labeled cells was present in area 10m at the frontal pole, and a dense strip of labeled cells extended caudally through areas 10m and 14r into area 25. Areas 32 and 24b contain patches of labeled cells. Laterally there is also substantial cell label in area 12o."

@Injections.Citation: "Four retrograde tracer injections were made in area 12o (cases OM7, OM14, and two injections in case MR1, not illustrated)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "These show that inputs to this area arise in the agranular insular area Iai, the medial wall areas 10m, 14r, 24b, 32, the frontal pole area 10o, and the dorsolateral prefrontal areas 9 and 46, plus parts of areas 12l,12m, and 13l adjacent to 12o. None of these areas were labeled with tracer injections into areas 12r, 12m and 12l, except for the areas immediately adjacent to area 12o. In addition to these dense projections, retrograde tracer injections into area 12o label scattered cells in almost every prefrontal area (Fig. 12). Also, retrograde tracer injections into the other areas of the OMPFC almost invariably labeled at least a few cells in 12o (Figs. 3-15). Furthermore, the retrograde tracer injections into areas 12r, 12m, and 12l labeled substantial numbers of cells in area 12o, and the retrograde tracer injections into area 12o labeled a dense population of cells in areas 12r, 12m, and 12l."

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: The labeled portion of the area might correspond to the SEF

@Injections.Citation: "...and a retrograde tracer injection was placed into area 13b (case OM8, Fig. 13)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The retrograde tracer injection into area 13b labeled a dense population of cells in rostral area 13a, primarily in layer V. Both areas 13a and 13b are also connected with areas in the central and lateral orbital cortex, including areas 11m, 13m, 12o, and to a lesser extent 13l (Fig. 13). In addition, the injections in area 13a labeled dense concentrations of cells or axons in agranular insular areas Iam, Iai, and Iapm, and in areas 14r and 14c. The injection in area 13b, on the other hand, labeled more cells in area 11l."

@Injections.Citation: "Two retrograde tracer injections (case OM13, Fig. 14) and one anterograde tracer injection (case OM16, not illustrated) were confined to area 11m."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In OM13 two injections of retrograde tracers (fast blue and diamidino yellow) were placed into non-overlapping parts of area 11m (Fig. 14). The pattern of retrograde label was very similar from both injections, and very different than that from the injection into area 11l. Dense concentrations of retrogradely labeled cells filled area 11m and continued caudally in a strip through areas 13b and 13a. A dense collection of labeled cells was also found in area Iai, and scattered cells were present in 12o. In the medial wall, patches of labeled cells were present in area 32, and in the rostral part of area 24a near the genu of the corpus callosum (see also Carmichael and Price, 1995a). Patches of labeled cells were also present in dorsolateral prefrontal areas 9 and 46. Thus, unlike area 11l, area 11m receives input primarily from the medial orbital cortex, the medial wall, and the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, and from orbital areas that connect with the medial wall, especially area Iai. Areas 11m and 11l are only partially interconnected. The injections into area 11m label many cells only in the rostral and medial part of area 11l (Fig. 14). Similarly, the injection into the caudolateral part of area 11l in OM21 labeled only a few cells in 11m."

@Injections.Citation: "In OM6, a retrograde tracer injection was placed into area 14c that slightly involved 14r, the caudal part of area 10m, and a small part of area 25."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "All of these areas are strongly interconnected with each other and with neighboring areas, especially on the medial wall. Following retrograde tracer injections into either areas 14c or 14r, dense concentrations of labeled cells and fibers fill both areas and extends into areas 10m, 10o, 11m, 13b, 25,32, and the rostral part of area 24b (Fig. 15). Label is also found in the rostral part of the dorsolateral areas 46 and 9. There is also substantial label in areas Iai and 12o, but very little label elsewhere in the orbital cortex (Fig. 15)."

@Injections.Citation: "An anterograde tracer injection (fluoro-ruby) was placed into Iam in case OM20 (Fig. 8)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "An anterograde tracer injection (fluoro-ruby) was placed into Iam in case OM20 (Fig. 81, which demonstrated the reciprocal nature of most of the connections of Iam. The pattern of labeled axons in this case closely resembled the pattern of retrograde cell labeling seen in OM8, although there were some differences. As with the retrograde label in OM8, anterogradely labeled fibers densely innervated neighboring agranular insula areas Ial, Iapm, and Iapl, whereas area Iai contained only a few labeled fibers (Fig. 8). Laterally, however, there was little label in area 12o, although areas 12l and PrCO contained substantial anterograde label."

@Injections.Citation: "Both anterograde and retrograde tracer injections were placed into area 14r, in OM18 and OM19, respectively"
"Both retrograde and anterograde tracer injections were placed into area 13a (cases OM15 and OM19, respectively; Fig. 13)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Both retrograde and anterograde tracer injections were placed into area 13a (cases OM15 and OM19, respectively; Fig. 13l, and a retrograde tracer injection was placed into area 13b (case OM8, Fig. 13). These show that the two areas are strongly and reciprocally interconnected. The injections into area 13a produced many labeled cells and axons throughout most of area 13b. The retrograde tracer injection into area 13b labeled a dense population of cells in rostral area 13a, primarily in layer V. Both areas 13a and 13b are also connected with areas in the central and lateral orbital cortex, including areas 11m, 13m, 12o, and to a lesser extent 13l (Fig. 13). In addition, the injections in area 13a labeled dense concentrations of cells or axons in agranular insular areas Iam, Iai, and Iapm, and in areas 14r and 14c. The injection in area 13b, on the other hand, labeled more cells in area 11l. Unlike area 13b, area 13a has substantial connections with the medial wall, frontal pole, and dorsal prefrontal cortex. The anterograde tracer injection into area 13a produced a large number of labeled axons in areas 10o, 10m, 32, and 24b. Conversely, the retrograde tracer injection in 13a labeled only a few cells in the medial wall areas, indicating that the projection from area 13a is not reciprocated. This result is in agreement with the retrograde and anterograde tracer labeling following injections into the medial wall, described above. Finally, there was both cellular and axonal label from area 13a in area 46 in the dorsal and ventral banks of the principal sulcus and in area 9."

publication.title: Connectional networks within the orbital and medial prefrontal cortex of Macaque monkeys
publication.abstract: The intrinsic cortico-cortical connections within the orbital and medial prefrontal cortex (OMPFC) were demonstrated with retrograde and anterograde tracers injected into each of the architectonic areas that constitute this region. Although many of the connections linked neighboring areas, others selectively connected relatively distant areas. Most, but not all, of the connections were reciprocal. Altogether, the connections formed at least two distinct networks within the OMPFC. The "orbital" prefrontal network linked most of the areas within the orbital cortex, with very few connections to medial prefrontal areas. Areas Iam, Iapm, Ial, 12l, 12m, and 12r in the caudal and lateral parts of the orbital cortex (which received inputs from several sensory modalities) had convergent connections with areas 13l, 13m, and 13b in the central orbital cortex, with further connections to the rostral orbital area 11l. For the connections between areas Iapm, Iam, Ial, 13m, 13l, and 11l, rostrally directed fibers arose mainly in layer V, whereas caudally directed fibers originated mainly in layer III. The "medial" prefrontal network selectively involved medial areas 14r, 14c, 24, 25, 32, and 10m, rostral orbital areas 10o and 11m, and agranular insular area Iai in the posterior orbital cortex. Two orbital areas, 13a and 12o, had substantial connections to both networks and may serve as points of interaction between them; otherwise there were relatively few interconnections. The two networks also had distinct connections with other cortical regions, with limbic structures, and with the mediodorsal thalamic nucleus. Their role in guidance of affective behaviour is discussed.
